intro: Aster × patulus, commonly known as the New England aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring lance-shaped leaves and showy purple to blue flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for garden landscapes and pollinator habitats.
